009package imagingbook.pub.geometry.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.awt.Shape;
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
019import imagingbook.pub.hough.lines.HoughLine;
020
021/**
022 * This class represents an algebraic line of the form A x + B  y + C = 0.
023 * Instances are immutable and normalized such that ||(A,B)|| = 1.
024 * @author WB
025 *
026 */
027public class AlgebraicLine {
028        
029        private final double A, B, C;
030        
031        // constructors --------------------------------------------------
032
033        public AlgebraicLine(double a, double b, double c) {
034                double norm = Math.sqrt(sqr(a) + sqr(b));
035                if (isZero(norm)) {
036                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("a and b may not both be zero");
037                }
038                this.A = a / norm;
039                this.B = b / norm;
040                this.C = c / norm;
041        }
042        
043        public AlgebraicLine(double[] p) {
044                this(p[0], p[1], p[2]);
045        }
046        
047        public AlgebraicLine(AlgebraicLine L) {
048                this(L.A, L.B, L.C);
049        }
050        
051        // static factory methods ----------------------------------------
052        
053        // Line from start point s and direction vector v
054        public static AlgebraicLine from(double[] s, double[] v) {
055                double A = -v[1];
056                double B = v[0];
057                double C = v[1] * s[0] - v[0] * s[1];
058                return new AlgebraicLine(A, B, C);
059        }
060        
061        public static AlgebraicLine from(ParametricLine pl) {
062                return AlgebraicLine.from(pl.getS(), pl.getV());
063        }
064        
065        public static AlgebraicLine from(Pnt2d p0, Pnt2d p1) {
066//              double A = p0.getY() - p1.getY();
067//              double B = p1.getX() - p0.getX();
068//              double C = -A * p0.getX() - B * p0.getY();
069//              return new AlgebraicLine(A, B, C);
070                double[] s = p0.toDoubleArray();
071                double[] v = p1.minus(p0).toDoubleArray();
072                return AlgebraicLine.from(s, v);
073        }
074        
075        // TODO: replace by direct calculation
076        public static AlgebraicLine from(SlopeInterceptLine sil) {
077                double A = sil.getK();
078                double B = sil.getD();
079//              Pnt2d p0 = Pnt2d.from(0, B);
080//              Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, A + B);
081//              return AlgebraicLine.from(p0, p1);
082                return new AlgebraicLine(A, -1, B);
083        }
084        
085        // getter/setter methods ------------------------------------------
086        
087        public double[] getParameters() {
088                return new double[] {A, B, C};
089        }
090        
091        public final double getA() {
092                return A;
093        }
094
095        public final double getB() {
096                return B;
097        }
098
099        public final double getC() {
100                return C;
101        }
102        
103        public double getXref() {
104                return 0.0;
105        }
106        
107        public double getYref() {
108                return 0.0;
109        }
110        
111        // other methods ------------------------------------------
112        
113        /**
114         * Returns the perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
115         * The result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line
116         * (x, y) is located. It is assumed that the line is normalized, i.e.,
117         * ||(a,b)|| = 1.
118         * 
119         * @param x x-coordinate of point position.
120         * @param y y-coordinate of point position.
121         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
122         */
123        public double getDistance(double x, double y) {
124                return (A * (x - this.getXref()) + B * (y - this.getYref()) + C);
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Returns the perpendicular distance between this line and the point p. The
129         * result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line p is
130         * located.
131         * 
132         * @param p point position.
133         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point p.
134         */
135        public double getDistance(Pnt2d p) {
136                return getDistance(p.getX(), p.getY());
137        }
138        
139        /**
140         * Returns the point on the line that is closest to the specified
141         * 2D point. The line is assumed to be normalized.
142         * 
143         * @param p an arbitrary 2D point
144         * @return the closest line point
145         */
146        public Pnt2d getClosestLinePoint(Pnt2d p) {
147                final double s = 1.0; // 1.0 / (sqr(a) + sqr(b)); // assumed to be normalized
148                final double xr = this.getXref();
149                final double yr = this.getYref();
150                double xx = p.getX() - xr;
151                double yy = p.getY() - yr;
152                double x0 = xr + s * (sqr(B) * xx - A * B * yy - A * C);
153                double y0 = yr + s * (sqr(A) * yy - A * B * xx - B * C);
154                return PntDouble.from(x0, y0);
155        }       
156
157        public double getSquareError(Pnt2d[] points) {
158                double sum2 = 0;
159                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
160                        sum2 = sum2 + sqr(getDistance(p));
161                }
162                return sum2;
163        }
164        
165        public Pnt2d intersect(AlgebraicLine L2) {
166                AlgebraicLine L1 = this;        
167                double det = L1.A * L2.B - L2.A * L1.B;
168                if (isZero(det)) {
169                        return null;
170                }
171                else {
172                        double x = (L1.B * L2.C - L2.B * L1.C) / det;
173                        double y = (L2.A * L1.C - L1.A * L2.C) / det;
174                        return Pnt2d.from(x, y);
175                }
176        }
177        
178        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
179        
180        // TODO: this is temporary, write a general method (without HoughLine)!
181        public Shape getShape(int width, int height) {
182                HoughLine hl = new HoughLine(this, 0.5 * width, 0.5 * height, 0);
183                return hl.getShape(width, height);
184        }
185        
186        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
187        
188        @Override
189        public boolean equals(Object other) {
190                if (this == other) {
191                        return true;
192                }
193                if (other instanceof AlgebraicLine) {
194                        AlgebraicLine L1 = this;
195                        AlgebraicLine L2 = (AlgebraicLine) other;
196                        double delta = 1E-6;
197                        // get two different points on L1:
198                        Pnt2d xA = L1.getClosestLinePoint(PntDouble.ZERO);
199                        Pnt2d xB = PntDouble.from(xA.getX() - L1.B, xA.getY() + L1.A);
200                        // check if both points are on L2 too:
201                        return (isZero(L2.getDistance(xA), delta) && isZero(L2.getDistance(xB), delta));
202                }
203                else {
204                        return false;
205                }
206        }
207        
208        @Override
209        public String toString() {
210                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <a=%.3f, b=%.3f, c=%.3f>",
211                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), A, B, C);
212        }
213        
214        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
215        
216        public static void main (String[] args) {
217                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, 2);
218                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(4, 3);
219                Pnt2d p3 = Pnt2d.from(9, -7);
220                AlgebraicLine L1 = AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2);
221                AlgebraicLine L2 = AlgebraicLine.from(p3, p2);
222                {
223                        Pnt2d x = L1.intersect(L2);
224                        System.out.println("x = " + x);
225                        System.out.println("x = p2 ? " + x.equals(p2));
226                }
227                {
228                        Pnt2d x = L2.intersect(L1);
229                        System.out.println("x = " + x);
230                        System.out.println("x = p2 ? " + x.equals(p2));
231                }
232                
233                
234                Pnt2d y = L1.intersect(L1);     // --> null
235                System.out.println("y = " + y);
236        }
237}
238
239//      x = PntDouble[4.000, 3.000]
240//      x = p2 ? true
241//      x = PntDouble[4.000, 3.000]
242//      x = p2 ? true
243//      y = null
